business.headline: Sensex, Nifty extend losses amid weak rupee and IT sector declineThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to close at 77,339.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 78.90 points to end at 23,453.80.

Tata seals deal to acquire 60% of Pegatron's Tamil Nadu iPhone plant: ReportUnder the agreement, Tata will hold a 60% stake in the plant and oversee daily operations, while Pegatron will retain the remaining 40% and provide technical support.

Telangana government announces 100% tax exemption for electric vehiclesThe Telangana government's initiative is a part of its broader electric vehicle policy aimed at creating an eco-friendly transport system while reducing pollution levels in Hyderabad and other urban centres.

Amazon India to move Bengaluru headquarters to cut costs: ReportThe relocation is aimed at reducing costs and will involve vacating 500,000 square feet of office space across 18 floors at the WTC, which is owned by Brigade Enterprises Ltd.

Foxconn tells India recruiters not to ask for marital status in iPhone job adsFoxconn, which employs thousands of women at the iPhone factory at Sriperumbudur, near Chennai, outsources recruitment of assembly-line workers to third-party vendors.

Stock market correction: How bad is the selloff in smallcap and midcap space?Stock Market Correction: Despite aggressive selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) in Indian equities, ICICI Securities recently noted that small-cap and mid-cap indices have shown relative resilience compared to the Nifty.

Gold prices are falling in India but rising globally. 3 reasons whyGold prices have seen a decline, bringing prices closer to lows recorded in September. Globally, however, gold prices have edged higher due to geopolitical and economic factors.

Sensex, Nifty fall as market bloodbath continues. 4 things investors should knowStock market correction: Sensex and Nifty have entered a correction zone, marked by a drop of more than 10% from their recent highs. The sell-off has rattled retail investors, many of whom are now asking a pressing question: Has the market bottomed out, or is there more pain ahead?

Final day to buy MRF shares for dividend eligibility ahead of ex-dividend dateThe board of MRF, in its recent meeting, announced the interim dividend while also releasing its financial results for the second quarter that ended on September 30, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: At AQI of 493, Delhi faces worst pollution of season; strictest curbs in placeDelhi's air quality plunged to hazardous levels on Monday, recording a season-high AQI of 493. Strict Stage 4 curbs under GRAP, including truck bans and halted public construction, are enforced in the capital city.

Amit Shah chairs meet amid Manipur unrest, 50 central force units to be deployedUnion Home Minister Amit Shah chaired a high-level meeting on Monday to discuss the ongoing situation in Manipur as the violence in the state escalated. This marked the second consecutive day of deliberations led by the Home Minister on the state's security concerns.

Maharashtra Muslim quota talks after new government forms: Revanth ReddyMaharashtra Election: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said it is Congress' 'responsibility to do justice to them (Muslims)', by providing reservations.

Why AAP rushed to get Shokeen as minister within a day of Gahlot's exitThe AAP government in Delhi on Monday named Jat leader Raghuvinder Shokeen as a Cabinet minister, a day after transport minister Kailash Gahlot resigned from the party. The swift move by the Arvind Kejriwal-led party to have Shokeen, the Nangloi Jat MLA, reveals the importance of Jat votes in the state's politics ahead of the 2025 Assembly election.
Working out is great, but how much is too much?Incorporating workouts into your daily routine is fantastic, but it's equally important to know where to draw the line.

GRAP-IV curbs stay, AQI must be brought down: Supreme Court to Centre, statesGRAP 4: A Supreme Court bench, comprising Justices Abhay S. Oka and Augustine George Masih, emphasised the constitutional duty of both the central and state governments to ensure a pollution-free environment.

Khamenei unwell, Iran might have secretly elected its next supreme leaderIran's supreme leader Ali Khamenei is reported to be seriously unwell. Amid concerns over his health, reports emerged of a succession battle. It is being said now that his second son, Mojtaba Khamenei, has been chosen to lead the Shia Islamic nation amid a confrontation with Israel.

Tears of farmers have set onions on fire. When will prices cool down?Onion prices touched Rs 100 a kilogram in several cities in India. Though some onion shortages, which drive up prices, are usually seen during this time of the year, the crisis this year is far worse, and has tears of farmers fuelling it. When will onion prices come down?

If all states ban liquor...: Diljit Dosanjh's bold declaration at Ahmedabad concertSinger Diljit Dosanjh, during his Ahmedabad concert, boldly asked the authorities not to 'poke' him. His outburst came after the Telangana government sent him a notice about avoiding mention of alcohol in songs during his performance.

Advocate flags construction inside Supreme Court as top court hears pollution pleaAdvocate Gopal Sankarnarayanan highlighted the issue when the Supreme Court was taking stock of the pollution levels from Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) and the Delhi government.

Nayanthara vs Dhanush: Who is right?Nayanthara wrote a loaded open letter to Dhanush over his legal notice regarding unauthorised use of clips from Naanum Rowdy Dhaan in her Netflix documentary. In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, producers and a lawyer weighed in on the controversy.

Lungs in 10th, 12th no different: In Supreme Court, an argument over classesThe Delhi government has already discontinued physical classes for all students, except for Class 10 and 12 students. The Supreme Court has now directed all states to take an immediate call to stop physical classes for Class 10 and 12 students as well.

Only 7 US states still need graduation exams. Why are more states ditching them?A growing number of US states are moving away from standardised tests as graduation requirements, citing equity concerns, pandemic setbacks, and questions about their role in measuring readiness.

Woman 'jokes' about Deepika Padukone's depression, fans irked as Tanmay-Samay laughIn a viral video from India's Got Latent, a YouTube comedy show, a contestant 'jokes' about Deepika Padukone's battle with depression and the judges on the panel laugh uncontrollably.
Indian-origin CEO claims he got death threats over 84-hour workweek policyDaksh Gupta, CEO of Greptile, sparked controversy after detailing the company's intense work culture in a viral post.

3 years after Gujarat family froze to death on Canada border, US trial to startFour members of a family from Dingucha, Gujarat, froze to death while attempting to illegally cross into the US from Canada. After nearly three years, a US court is scheduled to begin the jury selection process for the trial of two human smugglers linked to the deaths in January 2022.

Bengaluru auto driver's innovative approach to raise funds for his startup is viralA photo of the Bengaluru auto driver was shared on Reddit with the caption, "Yet another Peak Bengaluru moment", prompting admiration for his entrepreneurial spirit.

120 Bahadur: Farhan Akhtar as Major Shaitan Singh honours warriors of 1962 warActor Farhan Akhtar shared the first-look poster of his upcoming film, 120 Bahadur. The film will honour the soldiers who sacrificed their lives during this pivotal chapter of the 1962 Indo-China war.

sports.headline: Rafael Nadal keen on not making Davis Cup his farewell show: 'Not here to retire'Davis Cup Finals: Rafael Nadal acknowledged the buzz in Malaga around his retirement, but the Spaniard said he doesn't want to make it a spectacle. Nadal added he is focused on helping the team win, regardless of whether he gets to play.

Virat Kohli reveals his favourite hundred in Australia. It's not Adelaide 2014Star India batter Virat Kohli revealed his most favourite century in Australia in a recent video shared by the BCCI. Kohli has scored six Test centuries in Australia from 13 matches.

With spin maestros Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav, South African Tristan Stubbs and rising star Abishek Porel, DC retained a young core. Armed with Rs 73 crore and two RTM cards, DC may look to resign ex-captain Shreyas Iyer.

Rohit Sharma set to miss Perth Test, might join team directly in AdelaideBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India captain Rohit Sharma is set to miss the opening Test match in Perth, sources have confirmed to India Today. Sharma is likely to join the team in Adelaide ahead of the 2nd Test.

Bracewell tests positive for cocaine, handed one-month ban from cricketFormer New Zealand cricketer Doug Bracewell has been banned for one month after testing positive for cocaine. The 34-year-old was found to have used the banned substance following a stellar performance in a domestic T20 match for Central Districts against Wellington in January 2024.

BGT Recap: When Maxwell mocked Kohli's shoulder injury only to receive fiery sendoffBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Mocked by Glenn Maxwell for his shoulder injury during the 2017 Ranchi Test, Virat Kohli hit back with a fiery gesture of his own. The intense rivalry fuelled India's spirit, leading them to a memorable 2-1 series victory.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
